message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DC, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with interference coordination and resource allocation problems in wireless networks, which are typically studied in the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-categories. The use of belief propagation methods to solve these problems is a common technique in Statistical Mechanics (cs.SI) and Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-categories. Finally, the paper also discusses the optimization of transmit powers, transmit beamforming vectors, and sub-band allocation, which are topics studied in the Learning (cs.LG) sub-category.
